title: Restaurant Review: Superiority Burger Has the Courage of Its Quirks
description: Brooks Headley could have cloned his wildly popular vegetarian spot. Instead, its new space doubles down on idiosyncrasy.By Pete Wells
author: Pete Wells

title: This $5,750-a-Month Brooklyn Apartment Has a Smell Test
description: New Yorkers are used to finding quirky situations when apartment hunting, but a ban on cooking meat and fish in the building might be a new one.By Andy Newman
author: Andy Newman

title: Peter Singer: Fix Your Diet, Save the Planet
description: We can do something significant for the planet every time we eat.By Peter Singer
author: Peter Singer

title: Why New York’s (Mostly) Vegan Mayor Wants to Cut the City’s Meat Budget
description: The city estimates that its food purchases produce as much carbon as the exhaust from 70,000 gas-fueled cars.By Dana Rubinstein
author: Dana Rubinstein

title: From the Creator of the New Series ‘Transatlantic,’ a Surrealist-Inspired Lunch
description: Ahead of her latest show’s release, Anna Winger hosted a meal for her friends and collaborators, complete with custom tarot cards.By Gisela Williams
author: Gisela Williams

title: This Vegan Soup Is Rich With Peanuts, Potatoes and Comfort
description: The flavors in a bowl of South American sopa de maní are soulful and steadying.By Ligaya Mishan
author: Ligaya Mishan

title: Private Dinner Party: Clothing Not Allowed
description: The Füde Dinner Experience gathers those who want to meet, eat and drink  — only after leaving their clothes at the door.By Madeleine Aggeler
author: Madeleine Aggeler

title: A Newcomer in the Mushrooming Field of ‘Animal-Free’ Meats
description: Cutlets and “steaks” without the meat, a few Easter treats and more.By Florence Fabricant
author: Florence Fabricant

title: Soy, Oat and Almond Drinks Can Be Called Milk, F.D.A. Says
description: Plant-based beverage makers hailed the agency’s decision but objected to the recommendation for labels to specify the nutritional differences with cow’s milk.By Andrew Jacobs
author: Andrew Jacobs

title: Keep Your Politics Out of My Arugula
description: Whether to eat meat shouldn’t be a red-blue issue.By Pamela Paul
author: Pamela Paul
